entities: International Committee of the Red Cross
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports prior to the termination of the period defined
summary:
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council,
 
1. Requests all parties to abide by their obligations under international law, particularly regarding civilian needs in Iraq.
2. Calls on the international community to provide immediate humanitarian assistance to the people of Iraq.
3. Decides to make interim and exceptional adjustments to the "Oil-for-Food" Programme to ensure humanitarian relief.
4. Authorizes the Secretary-General to:
(a) Establish alternative locations for delivery and inspection of humanitarian supplies.
(b) Review and prioritize approved contracts for humanitarian supplies.
(c) Contact suppliers to adjust shipments.
(d) Negotiate adjustments to contracts and letters of credit.
(e) Negotiate and execute new contracts for essential medical items.
(f) Transfer funds between accounts to ensure humanitarian deliveries.
The Security Council 
authorizes the Secretary-General 
to: 
- use supplies to the people of Iraq 
- utilize funds in escrow accounts 
from resolution 986 (1995) 
for the Programme 
irrespective of the phase 
in which funds entered 
the accounts 
or allocated to;
- use funds to compensate 
suppliers and shippers 
for additional costs 
incurred from diverting 
and delaying shipments 
as directed;
- meet operational 
and administrative costs 
from the escrow account; 
- use funds for locally 
produced goods 
and local costs 
for essential civilian needs;
 Expresses readiness
